name: alt Filler
description: Fill empty `alt` attributes with file name
author: Vittorio Ramponi - www.mywebpassion.it

messageInOptions.text: This plugin automatically populates empty alt attributes (alt="") and adds missing alt attributes to tags, using the corresponding image file name as the value. It ensures your images are more accessible and SEO-friendly

config.note:
The Plugin Alt Filler processes featured images, single images, and galleries across all site pages. File names are adjusted for improved readability with the following enhancements:
  • Removal of the file extension
  • Removal of the "-thumbnail" suffix for gallery images
  • Removal of final numbers: "#", "-#", "_#", "(#)"
  • Replacement of "%20" with spaces
  • Removal of special characters: "(", ")", "[", "]", "!", "?", "%"
  • Replacement of separators: "-", "_", ".", "," with spaces
  • Replacement of multiple spaces with a single space
  • Truncation to 125 characters to avoid overly long descriptions
  • Convert to lowercase with the first letter capitalized
  • Addition of a period at the end
Example
<img src="/media/posts/11/gallery/WHITE-cloud-2-in-blue-sky-(12)-thumbnail.webp" alt="">
<img src="/media/posts/11/gallery/WHITE-cloud-2-in-blue-sky-(12)-thumbnail.webp" alt="White cloud 2 in blue sky.">

Note
The plugin uses regular expressions and is designed to work with code generated by Publii. It may not function properly on manually written, pasted, or custom template-derived code. Specifically, keep in mind that:
  • If the "alt" attribute is missing, it will be added automatically. If it is already present but empty ("alt="""), it will be filled with the processed file name.
  • The "alt" attribute does not need to follow the "src" attribute immediately, but the "src" or "srcset" attribute must be present for the plugin to work.
  • The position of other attributes, such as "title", is irrelevant and does not affect the plugin's functionality.
The filling of "alt" attributes is applied only to the HTML output. Publii's backend content remains unchanged.
